alert.note: Alert for Coeur d'Alene Area; Northern Panhandle (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 20 at 3:02PM MST until December 20 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM PST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM WEDNESDAY TO NOON PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations up to 2 inches. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills of 15 to 5 below zero expected on Wednesday, before dropping to 20 to 30 degrees below zero Wednesday Night and Thursday morning. * WHERE...Sandpoint, Schweitzer Mountain Road, Athol, Post Falls, Bonners Ferry, Priest River, Eastport, Worley, Coeur d`Alene, and Hayden. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 7 PM PST this evening. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 4 AM Wednesday to Noon PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Tuesday evening and Wednesday morning commutes. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
